com.smartbear.readyapi.testserver.cucumber

Class CucumberRecipeExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smartbear.readyapi.testserver.cucumber.CucumberRecipeExecutor

  • public class CucumberRecipeExecutor
extends Object
    Executes a TestServer Recipe class using the TestServer endpoint specified in the testserver.endpoint system property (defaults to the public TestServer instance).

    • Method Detail

      • runTestCase

        public com.smartbear.readyapi.client.execution.Execution runTestCase(com.smartbear.readyapi.client.model.TestCase testCase,
                                                                     cucumber.api.Scenario scenario)
        Executes the specified TestCase and returns the Execution. If a scenario is specified and the testserver.cucumber.logfolder system property is set, the generated recipe will be written to the specified folder. It is possible to temporarily "bypass" recipe execution by specifying a testserver.cucumber.silent property - in which case testcases will not be submitted to the server, but still logged to the above folder.
        Parameters:
        testCase - the TestCase to execute
        scenario - the Cucumber scenario used to generate the specified Recipe
        Returns:
        the TestServer Execution for the executed TestCase
        Throws:
        com.smartbear.readyapi.client.execution.ApiException - if recipe execution failes

      • logScenarioToFile

        protected void logScenarioToFile(com.smartbear.readyapi.client.TestRecipe testRecipe,
                                 cucumber.api.Scenario scenario,
                                 String logFolder)
        Writes the specified testRecipe to a folder/file name deducted from the specified scenario
        Parameters:
        testRecipe - the test recipe to log
        scenario - the associated Cucumber scenario
        logFolder - the root folder for generated folders and files
